page.title: 12OWERMOIGNE STREET FAYRE
page.content: {OWERMOIGNE STREET FAYRE! 10.8.1985. } THIS FAYRE IS HELD BIENNIALLY IN AUGUST.IT IS RUN BY A COMMITTEE WHICH REPRESENTS ALL THE VOLUNTARY ORGANIZATIONS IN THE VILLAGE,AND THE PROCEEDS ARE DIVIDED BETWEEN THEM. IT IS A{COLOURFUL AFFAIR.}THE VILLAGERS DRESS IN PERIOD COSTUME,THEY SERVE PLOUGHMANS LUNCHES AND CREAM TEAS.STALLS LINE THE LANES AROUND THE VILLAGE GREEN.THERE ARE MANY SIDE SHOWS INCLUDING ONE{"TO GUESS THE {WEIGHT OF THE BULL".}THERE IS AN ART AND CRAFT DISPLAY IN THE HALL AND A FLOWER FESTIVAL AT THE CHURCH. ENTERTAINMENT IS PROVIDED BY THE MORRIS DANCERS,THE DURNOVARIA SILVER BAND{AND"BATTLE ACTION"}FROM THE BRITISH PLATE ARMOUR SOCIETY.THERE IS A CLAY PIGEON SHOOT.THE DAY ENDS WITH A BARN DANCE AND BARBECUE IN THE VILLAGE HALL.
